us.title: Tariffs And Other Inflationary Pressures
us.content: Claudia Sahm discusses the inevitability of inflation with Rob Isbitts and how government stimulus and changes in consumer behavior contributed to inflationary pressures. Tariffs can be inflationary, especially when it's hard to source goods from other countries, leading to higher prices for consumers.

us.title: Cathie Wood: We're in a rolling recession.
us.content: "We think we've been in a rolling recession, and that we are actually going to see some negative quarters here," says Ark Invest CEO Cathie Wood https://trib.al/dd5tgkq

us.title: 12 Quality Growth Stocks to Buy for an Unstable Market
us.content: The trick for investors is to find stocks that are already fairly cheap, have high growth potential, and are in a strong enough financial position to withstand a recession.

us.title: Pi Coin Price Crash To $1: Tight Pi Unlock Schedule To Blame?
us.content: Open-source innovator Pi struggles to keep their native crypto above $1 after a tremendous start a few weeks back.

us.title: Retail Investor Buys The Dip Despite Bearish Sentiment
us.content: It has been an interesting correction. The average retail investor was “buying the dip” despite having an extremely bearish outlook.

us.title: Bitcoin Will Rally to $180,000 As Investors Become Despondent, Says Venture Capitalist Dan Tapiero – Here's When
us.content: Macro investor and fund manager Dan Tapiero says he remains long-term bullish on Bitcoin (BTC) amid a correction that has seen the flagship crypto asset fall by around 24% from the all-time high recorded in January.

us.title: Retail investors ditch buy-the-dip mentality during the market correction
us.content: Retail outflows from U.S. equities rose to about $4 billion over the past two weeks, according to data from Barclays.

us.title: S&P Global Market Intelligence Announces Rankings of Best-Performing U.S. Credit Unions, Community and Public Banks and Community Banks by Region for 2024
us.content: NEW YORK , March 18, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- S&P Global Market Intelligence today released its annual rankings for 2024's best-performing community banks with assets between $3 billion and $10 billion, community banks with assets below $3 billion, credit unions, U.S. public banks with more than $10 billion in total assets and community banks by region for the Northeast, South Central, Southeast, West and Midwest. S&P Global Market Intelligence ranks institutions based on returns, growth and funding but places a premium on the strength and risk profile of balance sheets.

us.title: Verra Mobility partners with Verizon Connect to bring managed services to commercial fleets
us.content: Verizon Connect customers will receive access to Verra Mobility's managed tolling, violations and title and registration services MESA, Ariz. , March 18, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Verra Mobility Corporation (NASDAQ: VRRM), a leading provider of smart mobility technology solutions, announced today a partnership with Verizon Connect, one of the largest providers of advanced GPS fleet tracking solutions.

us.title: Lightspeed Partner on the Sputtering IPO Market
us.content: Arif Janmohamed says that while companies are ready to list, volatility is a factor stopping them from going public. Photo: Aria Isadora for WSJ

(NASDAQ: NNBR), a global diversified industrial company that engineers and manufactures high-precision components and assemblies, announced today that Harold Bevis, President and Chief Executive Officer, and Chris Bohnert, Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, will be presenting virtually at the Sidoti Small Cap Conference on Thursday March 20, 2025.

us.title: Cousins Properties Announces Its First Quarter 2025 Common Stock Dividend
us.content: ATLANTA , March 18, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Cousins Properties (NYSE: CUZ) announced today that its Board of Directors has declared a cash dividend of $0.32 per common share for the first quarter of 2025. The first quarter dividend will be payable on April 15, 2025 to common shareholders of record on April 3, 2025.

us.title: ACRES Commercial Realty Corp. Declares Quarterly Cash Dividends for its Preferred Stock
us.content: UNIONDALE, N.Y. , March 18, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- ACRES Commercial Realty Corp. (NYSE: ACR) (the "Company") announced today that its Board of Directors declared cash dividends on its Preferred Stock.

us.title: The Fed will update its rate projections Wednesday. Here's what to expect
us.content: Fed officials at this week's meeting are expected to hold interest rates steady but adjust their views on the economy and possibly the future path of interest rates. The committee could maintain its outlook for two cuts, remove one or both, or, improbably, add another as a statement of concern over a potential slowdown.

us.title: Market trend is still to the downside on the margin, says Schwab's Liz Ann Sonders
us.content: CNBC's Steve Liesman and Liz Ann Sonders, Charles Schwab chief investment strategist, join 'The Exchange' to discuss how the Fed factors into the market's weakness, what market uncertainty means for investors, and much more.

france.title: Keith Fitz-Gerald is still bullish on these 'undervalued' momentum stocks
france.content: Keith Fitz-Gerald, Fitz-Gerald Group CIO, joins 'Power Lunch' to discuss how to make sense of the market and the recession versus growth scare.

france.title: Ethereum hits 2025 lows on THESE fronts: Is ETH in trouble?
france.content: Ethereum's user activity drops sharply in 2025, raising concerns about its supply and long-term price stability. How long until Ethereum gives in?

france.title: Getty Images Rises on Strong Q4 Earnings, But 2025 Outlook Disappoints
france.content:
Getty Images Holdings (NYSE:GETY) saw its shares rise over 1% intra-day today after delivering better-than-expected fourth-quarter earnings, fueled by robust editorial revenue growth and higher annual subscription contributions. However, guidance for 2025 fell short of analyst expectations, tempering some of the enthusiasm.

The company reported adjusted earnings per share of $0.06, beating forecasts of $0.05, while revenue rose 9.5% year-over-year to $247.3 million, surpassing the expected $245.49 million.

Editorial revenue emerged as a standout performer, surging 19% year-over-year to $90.1 million. Additionally, annual subscription revenue accounted for 54.9% of total sales, up from 53.8% in the same quarter last year, signaling strong customer retention and recurring revenue expansion.

Despite the solid quarterly results, Getty’s full-year 2025 revenue projection of $918-$955 million fell short of the $958.7 million consensus estimate, raising some concerns about future growth momentum.

Net income for the quarter stood at $24.7 million, a decline from $39.1 million in Q4 2023, though results were impacted by a $45.9 million foreign exchange gain tied to its Euro Term Loan.

For the full year 2024, revenue increased 2.5% to $939.3 million, with net income nearly doubling to $39.5 million from $19.6 million in 2023.

france.title: Here's Why Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Dogecoin Slumped Today
france.content: The volatility we've seen become pervasive among risk assets has more than bled through into the cryptocurrency sector. Three of the most-watched (and most valuable) tokens today are Bitcoin (BTC -2.84%), Ethereum (ETH -1.96%) and Dogecoin (DOGE -5.02%).

france.title: Sportsman's Warehouse Holdings, Inc. Schedules Fourth Quarter and Full-Year 2024 Earnings Conference Call
france.content: WEST JORDAN, Utah, March 18, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Sportsman's Warehouse Holdings, Inc. ("Sportsman's Warehouse" or the "Company") (Nasdaq: SPWH) today announced that it will hold its quarterly conference call to discuss fourth quarter and full-year 2024 financial results on Tuesday, April 1, 2025, at 5:00 p.m. Eastern Time.

france.title: VeChain gets MiCAR nod for VET and VTHO whitepapers
france.content: VeChain has announced its tokens are compliant with European regulations after receiving confirmation from the European Securities and Markets Authority. VeChain (VET), the blockchain for real world decentralized applications, shared the milestone in an announcement on March 18.
